Diagnosis:
T2N0M0 basaloid squamous cell carcinoma of mid-esophagus

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes

Current medications:
Metformin 1g bd
Ramipril 5mg od

Allergies:
None reported

Current situation:
Newly diagnosed esophageal cancer following investigation of dysphagia

Endoscopy 15 March 2024 - 4cm ulcerated lesion at 28-32cm
CT 20 March 2024 - T2 mid-esophageal lesion, no nodal or distant metastases
PET-CT 1 April 2024 - Confirms localized disease only

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of staging investigations. He presents with a 3-month history of progressive dysphagia, initially for solids and now for semi-solid foods. He has lost 5kg in weight but maintains good appetite for soft foods. Performance status remains excellent at PS 0.

On examination, he appears well with no concerning findings. Weight today 78kg.

I have discussed the diagnosis and treatment options with [redacted name]. Given the localized nature of disease, we would recommend definitive chemoradiotherapy with curative intent. I have explained the treatment process and likely side effects. He will be reviewed at next week's Upper GI MDT for formal treatment planning.

The plan is to proceed with dental assessment, baseline hearing test, and EDTA clearance prior to treatment. We will see him again following MDT discussion with detailed treatment plan.
